positive.review: good game for sitting around and relaxing after work. I love the almost endless feel with a sense of progression still built in. the different tiers and ways to move forward are fun milestones and the prestige system is well rounded.

I love this game! Hard for me to take a break sometimes lol. I would say it has been fairly necessary for me to peruse through the game's Wiki for me to grasp a concept of what does what, but I've been managing to keep myself from spoiling anything as well!

Leaf Blower Revolution is deceptively simple, but somehow it keeps you coming back far longer than you‚Äôd expect. On the surface, it‚Äôs just an idle game where you blow leaves and upgrade your blower....but the little touches make it genuinely satisfying.

There‚Äôs something almost therapeutic about watching your numbers grow, unlocking new equipment, and seeing progress happen almost automatically. It scratches that oddly addictive itch that only idle games seem to hit perfectly. Upgrading your blower, unlocking new areas, and watching your ‚Äúleaf empire‚Äù expand gives a tiny but consistent sense of achievement.

The game doesn‚Äôt try to be anything it isn‚Äôt, and that honesty works in its favour. It‚Äôs light-hearted, a bit silly, and never pretentious. The humour sneaks in through little details, the animations are simple but charming, and there‚Äôs a subtle joy in seeing just how far you can push your blower upgrades.

Even as an idle game, it manages to keep you engaged. You‚Äôll find yourself checking in, tweaking upgrades, and planning your next big leaf-blowing session longer than you expected. It‚Äôs relaxing without being boring, and that‚Äôs a rare balance to strike

Final Rating: 7.1 / 10

Simple, satisfying, and surprisingly addictive. A small game that punches above its weight in fun
Its a pretty good game with simple game play for when you're bored

Who knew blowing leaves could turn into an addictive idle-time vortex? Leaf Blower Revolution starts as a simple pixel art game where you manually clear leaves, but before long, you‚Äôre managing upgrade trees, automation systems, currencies, and even interdimensional leaves. It‚Äôs oddly satisfying and surprisingly deep for what looks like a joke at first.

The progression system is what keeps you hooked‚Äîincremental upgrades snowball fast, and every unlock adds a layer of strategy. There‚Äôs no paywall nonsense, just genuine satisfaction in optimizing your setup. Perfect for tabbing into between tasks or zoning out after a long day.

The humor is self-aware, the community is friendly, and the devs actively update the game with clever new features. If you enjoy idle/incremental games like Cookie Clicker or NGU Idle, this one blows them away‚Äîliterally.

Pros:

Extremely chill yet addictive

Smart upgrade and automation systems

Frequent updates and active developer

Zero predatory monetization

Cons:

Gets grindy in later stages

Minimal visuals (but that‚Äôs part of the charm)

Verdict:
A relaxing, tongue-in-cheek idle game that‚Äôs way deeper than it looks. Perfect for background play or low-effort gaming sessions.

Rating: 9/10 ‚Äì ‚ÄúToo many leaves, not enough time.‚Äù

Would you like this review phrased more humorously (like a classic meme-style Steam review) or kept in this balanced, detailed tone?

Honestly for something that starts out so stupid, I never thought I would enjoy this so much. Its a fun game, and its become a strange sort of comfort game for me. Its never intense, its never too boring, I really like it.
Very very fun game, and is very relaxing when your stressed out or just bored

This game is insanely grindy. If you like that, like I do, this game is absolutely amazing. However, if not, then probably not. 

I will say though, out of every single idle game I've ever played, this is by FAR the best. Unlike most other games which focuses on a progression of a main currency, there is no "main currency" in this game. There are a bunch of different currencies that you unlock gradually, though it can be overwhelming in the mid game without outside resources. The only reason why I understand most of them is because I've been playing since before a lot of them were added so do beware, though the wiki is immensely helpful. 

One thing I also really like about this game is that most of the grinds in this game, it feels like you're always getting somewhere. The type of grinds that I hate are like hypixel skyblock types, where you have to kill the same enemy over and over to get this item with a super rare drop rate. I much prefer grinds where you have to kill something over and over again to get small amounts of a currency to eventualy save up to buy something big. This is much more what Leaf Blower Revolution feels like, and I love it. 

Also, at first glance, when you look at the premium currency shop, the gem shop, you see numerous upgrades that cost thousands, and so the game might look super pay to win at first glance, especially since  However, what you don't know initially is that gems in the later-end game are stupidly easy to grind. I can, at the point I am in the game, farm about 200 gems every two minutes, and if you afk farm it, you're doing maybe 1,000 an hour or so. So in reality, while the game might look p2w at first, it's really not. 

Yeah so basically the game is super grindy, but if you're into that, then it's really good. It can be confusing because of the sheer amount of content, but the wiki and also the discord are huge helps for that. Definitely one of the best idle and free games out there.

This game is great, but there is a game breaking bug that I ran into. If your monitor/pc goes into sleep mode while you are afk (Screen goes black after a certain time) the game will break and enter this strange border-less mini screen mode by itself. You can't click anything that isn't in the top right corner of the screen and you can't save and exit the game because your mouse will just drift off the screen and onto your desktop. You have the shut down the game manually through steam or tm to close it.

Otherwise this game is really awesome so far, no other issues, great time killer.

Who would have thought a yard work simulator would be so addicting! All the upgrade possible just keeps you coming back to clear more leaves. The best part is the game racks up leaves while you‚Äôre not even in the game! Simple, addicting, and it‚Äôs all free!
A unique idle clicker where you blow leaves to earn currency, unlock new tools, and explore different areas. It starts simple but gradually introduces layers of strategy and automation.
It's addictive. As the upgrades keep coming, you'll be dying to collect more leaves.

Leaf Blower Revolution is the peak of human evolution in idle gaming.
You literally blow leaves ‚Äî and somehow it becomes the most addictive number-go-up dopamine machine ever.
You start with basic leaf blowing‚Ä¶ then 15 minutes later you‚Äôre building Autoblowers, generating nuclear rocket engines, crafting weird stuff, doing minigames in a Cheese Pub and unlocking 30+ types of leaves that all give different bonuses.
It‚Äôs pure absurdity ‚Äî and it works.
Great game to relax with while watching a show / working / chilling.
Massive content. Huge progression. Silly theme. Serious fun.

negative.review: hard to not recommend it because its free. just play it. its a great game for a while but personally, twice now, i end up just hitting a massive wall. it reaches a point where it feels annoying/pointless to play because the loop THEN is just so so so boring. between crafting/trading and all of the random shit it introduces, its just a different game. and its not for me. i tried, i even bought the materials pack to help lol. early game is fun but the overall time investment is just not worth it when it ends up becoming so unfun. then when i hit that wall and lose interest, coming back to this game is so confusing. like id rather go play a game with actual substance, not a leaf blowing game made to be extremely convoluted

Meh. UI is pretty terrible. DLC's dont transfer. So I have no reason to play this version anymore. Has a lot of potential, but there's some big cracks that need to be resolved before i'd recommend it to anyone. The whole point of switching to the stream port is because the UI is so terrible on android it hurts my fingers.
The usual idle game that plateaus after an hour or so... waste of money.

Originally I would have recommended this game as it does end up being fun for a while, but then it becomes a boring grind. Especially when you get to the pyramid it feels like things come to an almost grinding halt. Too many systems for things and not a lot is explained. Its good for a free game for a bit but at this time I can't say I would play it for more than a couple hours maybe.

immediately unplayable. i select new game, it puts me into an in-progress save where i have no idea what's even happening. terrible music is exploding from the game, but i can't reach the taskbar to mute the application due to it being in a false fullscreen. finally mute it in-game in the 69 pages of options and go to change the game to render in a window. there is a windowed option but it doesn't work at all. sure it allows for the taskbar to exist again, but there's no top bar. no option in sight to actually start over and "afk mode" is only causing the game to play in a slideshow mode of lag.

i see they've abandoned basic playability in favour of their monetization.

'Did I ever tell you what the definition of insanity is? Insanity is doing the exact... same ******* thing... over and over again [expecting... shit to change].' 
(c) my friend Schul
(c) Vaas Montenegro, Far Cry 3

it's fun up until the pyramid, then there's just too many sub systems to keep track of and the game kinda grinds to a halt. the game does nothing to explain how things work so you have to go the the wiki's and those are pretty useless and outdated. imo this game is full of " lets keep adding more and more content to the game" without making sure it flows and meshes properly with all the previous content.  The "booster packs" are egregiously over priced as well, 2-3$ is fair but then there are the 14$-24$ packs which barely do anything for you other than giving you daily gems to make the grind for them [i]SLIGHTLY[/i] bearable.

it's fun up until the pyramid, then there's just too many sub systems to keep track of and the game kinda grinds to a halt. the game does nothing to explain how things work so you have to go the the wiki's and those are pretty useless and outdated. imo this game is full of " lets keep adding more and more content to the game" without making sure it flows and meshes properly with all the previous content.  The "booster packs" are egregiously over priced as well, 2-3$ is fair but then there are the 14$-24$ packs which barely do anything for you other than giving you daily gems to make the grind for them [i]SLIGHTLY[/i] bearable.

hard to not recommend it because its free. just play it. its a great game for a while but personally, twice now, i end up just hitting a massive wall. it reaches a point where it feels annoying/pointless to play because the loop THEN is just so so so boring. between crafting/trading and all of the random shit it introduces, its just a different game. and its not for me. i tried, i even bought the materials pack to help lol. early game is fun but the overall time investment is just not worth it when it ends up becoming so unfun. then when i hit that wall and lose interest, coming back to this game is so confusing. like id rather go play a game with actual substance, not a leaf blowing game made to be extremely convoluted

Meh. UI is pretty terrible. DLC's dont transfer. So I have no reason to play this version anymore. Has a lot of potential, but there's some big cracks that need to be resolved before i'd recommend it to anyone. The whole point of switching to the stream port is because the UI is so terrible on android it hurts my fingers.
The usual idle game that plateaus after an hour or so... waste of money.

Originally I would have recommended this game as it does end up being fun for a while, but then it becomes a boring grind. Especially when you get to the pyramid it feels like things come to an almost grinding halt. Too many systems for things and not a lot is explained. Its good for a free game for a bit but at this time I can't say I would play it for more than a couple hours maybe.

Lots of depth for an idle game, but found my experience of fun decreasing when having to aggressively loop coins for upgrades. By the time I got to the tower, it felt like real leaf-blowing: a bit of a chore.

immediately unplayable. i select new game, it puts me into an in-progress save where i have no idea what's even happening. terrible music is exploding from the game, but i can't reach the taskbar to mute the application due to it being in a false fullscreen. finally mute it in-game in the 69 pages of options and go to change the game to render in a window. there is a windowed option but it doesn't work at all. sure it allows for the taskbar to exist again, but there's no top bar. no option in sight to actually start over and "afk mode" is only causing the game to play in a slideshow mode of lag.

i see they've abandoned basic playability in favour of their monetization.

got to like the celestial world after like 6hrs, the game is basically restart over and over and over doing the same thing for that 1 stage, i liked the concept for it but it should be less dependent like the other lvls. I aint playing through that ~30+ 10minute restarts to get 1 upgrade if that.

Right now the game is impossible to play due to extreme lag and stuttering. While there are recommended fixes involving reducing graphics quality, this shouldn't be needed as the game should be able to run on a computer with a dedicated graphics card. Will continue playing on mobile for now.
it is as you expect from an idle game, but the busywork is surprisingly not in the leaf blowing, it's micromanaging the purchases. just doesn't scracht he idle game itch for me.

I wanted to like this, but I don't understand it. I need to get 50m BLC to open the next location, and after over 40 hours of play, I only end up with one million BLC at a time. I don't mind *some* grinding but that is way too much.
Gets really boring fast, and kinda a cashgrab in my eyes tbh.
UI and text are too small. for me unplayable.
This is extremely rare this happens for me but the graphics ruin it for me.
